name: pg_waldump
description: decodes and displays PostgreSQL write-ahead logs for debugging

options.description: output detailed information about backup blocks
with --relation, only show records that modify block N
stop reading at WAL location RECPTR
keep retrying after reaching end of WAL
only show records that modify blocks in fork FORK; valid names are main, fsm, vm, init
directory in which to find log segment files or a directory with a ./pg_wal that contains such files (default: current directory, ./pg_wal, $PGDATA/pg_wal)
do not print any output, except for errors
only show records generated by resource manager RMGR; use --rmgr=list to list valid resource manager names
only show records that modify blocks in relation T/D/R
start reading at WAL location RECPTR
timeline from which to read log records (default: 1 or the value used in STARTSEG)
only show records with a full page write
only show records with transaction ID XID
show statistics instead of records (optionally, show per-record statistics)
